name: blitzbrowser
description: Deploy and manage headful browsers in docker.
readme_summary: BlitzBrowser provides a managed Docker environment for running headful browsers, simplifying deployment and scaling. It allows direct connection from automation frameworks like Puppeteer and Playwright, offering features like live viewing, persistent sessions via S3, and proxy support without requiring extensive DevOps knowledge.
primary_use_case: Deploying and managing headful browser instances in Docker for web automation, testing, and scraping tasks, while abstracting away infrastructure complexities.
cover_image_prompt: A digital conductor orchestrating a symphony of browser windows, each represented by a vibrant, glowing orb. The conductor, a stylized silhouette, uses a baton that emits streams of code, directing the orbs to perform complex actions on a digital stage. Subtle visual cues like a live view screen showing a rendered webpage and data flowing into an S3 cloud icon indicate the browser's functionality. The background is a clean, modern interface with subtle UI elements. The overall mood is one of effortless control and powerful automation. Style: 3D isometric illustration with a futuristic, clean aesthetic and a vibrant color palette.

name: VibeNVR
description: Simple, privacy-respecting local NVR — fast setup, flexible recording, no cloud required
readme_summary: VibeNVR is a privacy-focused, local Network Video Recorder (NVR) system designed for efficient video surveillance. It offers a modern React-based interface, a custom high-performance video engine using Python, OpenCV, and FFmpeg, and features like smart motion detection, a unified event timeline, and secure authentication, all deployable via Docker.
primary_use_case: Setting up and managing a local, privacy-respecting video surveillance system for IP cameras without relying on cloud services.
cover_image_prompt: A vigilant, stylized owl with glowing blue eyes, perched on a branch made of network cables, overlooking a serene, dark forest. The owl's eyes project beams of light that scan and organize individual camera feeds, represented as small, floating digital windows displaying clear video streams. Subtle data particles flow from the cameras towards the owl, indicating processing and recording. In the background, a minimalist, modern UI element with the 'VibeNVR' logo is subtly integrated into a tree trunk. The overall mood is secure, private, and efficient, with a focus on local control. Style: 3D isometric illustration with a dark, atmospheric color palette and glowing accents.

name: ScreenCoder
description: ScreenCoder — Turn any UI screenshot into clean, editable HTML/CSS with full control. Fast, accurate, and easy to customize.
readme_summary: ScreenCoder is an intelligent system that converts UI screenshots into production-ready HTML/CSS code. It utilizes a modular multi-agent architecture for visual understanding, layout planning, and adaptive code synthesis, enabling accurate and editable front-end code generation.
key_features: UI screenshot to HTML/CSS code generation
Customizable modifications for layout and styling
Includes a benchmark dataset (ScreenBench) for visual-to-code generation
primary_use_case: Automating the conversion of UI designs or screenshots into editable HTML/CSS code for front-end development.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled artisan, embodying ScreenCoder, stands before a digital loom. On one side, a vibrant, detailed UI screenshot is fed into the loom. As the artisan works the loom, threads of light representing code (HTML and CSS) are intricately woven, forming a clean, structured webpage on the other side. Small, glowing icons of code editors and design tools float around the artisan, signifying customization. The background is a clean, modern studio with subtle digital patterns. The overall mood is one of efficient creation and transformation. The art style should be a 3D isometric illustration with bright, clear lighting and a focus on the transformation process.

name: devFind
description: devFind is an open source project that aims to create a platform for developers to showcase their skills and connect with potential collaborators, all in a user-friendly and searchable format.
readme_summary: devFind is an open-source platform designed for developers to create profiles showcasing their skills and connect with potential collaborators. Profiles are created in JSON format and are discoverable through a user-friendly, searchable interface.
key_features: Developer profile creation in JSON format
Search by skills, location, or name
Facilitates connection for collaboration or employment
primary_use_case: A platform for developers to showcase their skills and for others to find and connect with them.
cover_image_prompt: A vibrant, stylized illustration of a bustling digital marketplace where developers are represented as unique, glowing avatars. Each avatar has a subtle badge indicating their primary skills (e.g., a gear for backend, a brush for design, code brackets for programming). A central, friendly guide character is using a magical magnifying glass to scan through the avatars, highlighting specific ones that match search criteria like 'React expert' or 'UI/UX designer'. The background shows a network of interconnected nodes, symbolizing collaboration. Small, clean UI elements displaying search bars and results float subtly around the scene. The overall mood is collaborative and innovative, rendered in a 3D isometric illustration style with a bright, inviting color palette.
